title: Najaf
summary: Najaf (Arabic: ٱلنَّجَف‎) or An-Najaf al-Ashraf (Arabic: ٱلنَّجَف ٱلْأَشْرَف‎), also known as Baniqia (Arabic: بَانِيقِيَا‎), is a city in central Iraq about 160 km (100 mi) south of Baghdad. Its estimated population in 2013 was 1,000,000 people.[2] It is the capital of Najaf Governorate. It is widely considered amongst the holiest cities of Shia Islam and one of its spiritual capitals, whilst also remaining the center of Shia political power in Iraq.[8]
